title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA (Sylmar, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very good interview. But lower pay. Very nice people. I’m still trying to decide what company to choose. Benefits is a big factor . I’m trying to do research to which companies are better
Interview Questions: Most common questions work experience

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: I applied on their website. After a week I received an email from the doctor's assistant to schedule a Zoom interview. It was a week later. The interview was about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: A very nice doctor interviewed me and asked me questions to understand my resume and let me know what the job would entail. Nothing threatening or scary. About half an hour.

title: Nursing Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA (Santa Monica, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The process was easy in itself. It was about 30 minutes and over zoom and it was my first interview ever. There were about 4 people who interviewed me, but it wasn't that bad. There were a few scenario questions based on scope of practice.
Interview Questions: tell us about yourself and where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and fun as the interviewers were so kind. They ask questions regarding customer service, time management, and other questions about why you want to work at a library.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Powell Library?

title: Staff Research Associate I Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth - got initially contacted via email and then had 2 interviews - got the job shortly after! I have seen how others had to wait for a long time to hear back though , sometimes it takes along time to get your application reviewed and considered.
Interview Questions: What does your statistical and coding platform knowledge look like?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: First round is zoom coffee chat, get to know your background and how your interest align, asked some technical questions, second round is a presentation, demonstrate your knowledge of the lab to make sure you know what you will be dealing with.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself, how does your experience relate to this position

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA (Pasadena, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was somewhat difficult. Various interviews and a long wait time to hear back. You start with a phone interview which is followed by a zoom and whether you move forward or not you meet the hiring manager face to face.
Interview Questions: What is a time you failed at your job and how did you handle it afterwards?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: One-hour presentation of research. Followed by a detailed interview with the supervisor. He was direct and wanted to know exactly what my skillset was and my confidence in getting experimental work done.
Interview Questions: Can you build an electrolyzer in the lab?

title: RN New Grad Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers were very nice. Was only stressful because it was my first interview. The process is super slow and you'll be waiting to hear back for at least a week or two.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself Why do you want this unit Explain a time you had a difficult patient Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA (Santa Monica, CA)
Interview Descriptions: All online and asked good questions. They were pretty thorough I think. Wasn’t anything crazy difficult though. I think talking over Skype is always awkward but it wasn’t too bad.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here at this hospital?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA (UCLA, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied through their application. Got an interview about a month later. It was a zoom interview with the director of the department and an associate that I would be working under.
Interview Questions: Name a time when you had to solve a conflict in a previous job.

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA (UCLA, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Send in application and they will call you for an interview once selected. The interview is with the internship coordinator and is in-person. They are very friendly and asked good questions. Seems like a great opportunity.
Interview Questions: What are your future goals?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: A sit down interview with the manager. Since interviews are very dependent on the hiring manager, I can't speak for all positions, however, the interview with the SAIRO manager was great. She was very kind and professional.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself (background/experience).

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: It was very straightforward and self explanatory. I had a good time with the interview panel. They asked basic behavioral questions and did not feel intimidating. Overall, it was a decent interview as long as you prepared.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why do you want this job

title: Research and Development Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (UCLA, CA) in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was more informal and only involved one 45 minute zoom interview. Was asked a combination of technical and behavioral questions. The interviewer also spent a lot of the time explaining the research that the position would be focused on.
Interview Questions: How would a pull up resistor be used in a system?

title: Staff Research Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Brief discussion with staff about background and expectations of the job. Staff get a feel for you as a person and employee. Coming with questions of your own is very helpful.
Interview Questions: What did you do for your last job?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received a call the next day to interview, online interview and in-person interview. The entire process was fast because they wanted someone quick. Asked a lot of interview questions to try to see if your personality is fit for the team.
Interview Questions: What is something that you liked and disliked about your current/past job?

title: Statistical Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Technical interview was fair and interviews paced well. They were understanding about a technical difficulty and I was able to reschedule. The group interview had a few too many people on the call however. Overall a good experience.
Interview Questions: What are your expectations for growth in the next five years?

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Two days interviews with several faculties and deans. e.g, why here, why now? What you can bring to the School. Each faculty will interview the candidate and answer questions. It can be very energy driven, please have a good sleep the day before.
Interview Questions: Why here, why now? What you can bring to the School

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Not as stressful as I thought. The questions were basic interview questions. It was easy going even though it was with several managers. Each manager asked me few questions. The interview lasted about an hour.
Interview Questions: How do you work under pressure ?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: In my expereince the hiring team starts with a phone screening questionaire to guage ackground and competency. If all checks through, they then schedule an inital interview to cover the basic, usually with the direct supervisor. If greenlighted, the hiring teams sends the applicant to the final interview, usually with the department's director or AVC.
Interview Questions: What projects have you worked on in the last year

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Not bad. It wasn’t scary but the interviewer was strange. So not sure if this is always the case. Either way kept posed and answered everything honestly. Did not get offer but not the end of the world
Interview Questions: Why role are you expecting here

title: New Grad RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: applied for position in september, interview notification late october, interview mid- november; 30 min zoom interview with unit manager and assistant manager; average interview questions. the interviewers were very nice
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself; Describe a difficult situation and how did you resolve it; Describe a situation how you went above and beyond

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: In-person interview with two staff. First asked questions about my education and previous experience. Then asked questions about how I will fit this position. What are my specific strength and skills.
Interview Questions: What is my most proficient programming language.

title: IT Systems Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview questions were asked. Slightly formal interview tone. Was asked about projects I had worked on and how they relate to the role. HR and Manager were great to deal with.
Interview Questions: - Describe projects you have worked on - Technical question about systems on the job description

title: CLICC Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: It was mostly behavioral questions like how do you time manage, how do you work in a group, how do you solve a problem etc. It was fairly straightforward interview and the interviewers were very friendly
Interview Questions: How do you time manage? How do you stay organized?

title: Assistant Resident Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: the process of scheduling the interview was well organized and provided a great base for me to prepare for my interview. the interview had a great panel and went smoothly.
Interview Questions: How would you incorporate social justice into your leadership role as an ARD and within your team

title: Mental Health Clinician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: First interview with hiring team, second interview is presentation with all staff invited to attend, followed by interview with leadership team. Seeking those experienced with diverse presentations. Seeking those with crisis management and hospitalization experience.
Interview Questions: Discuss you experience in addressing culture in your sessions.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very smooth, you probably already got clear instructions on how is the interview going to be, very detailed instructions, and non-aggressive feelings. consists of fairness, openness, and integrity.
Interview Questions: What is your expectation here?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: no interview but direct hire from professor,no interview but direct hire from professor,no interview but direct hire from professor,no interview but direct hire from professor,no interview but direct hire from professor
Interview Questions: no interview but direct hire from professor

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds of interviews total. The first round was only with two of the program directors. Then the second was with the same two directors, plus the faculty and admin director.
Interview Questions: Why I was interested in that specific position? How would I approach specific challenging scenarios - both with students and with colleagues?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: It was a long process from start to finish. Took a while to hear back initially and then to interview. Basic questions asked then called for offer. Took time to answer questions
Interview Questions: Where do u see yourself in 5 years

title: Cash Management Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Easy, just asked to go over your resume, if you have any experience in customer service or cash handling. Interview took less than an hour, really nice people. Did ask if you had a problem working remote and in person
Interview Questions: Can you describe your resume, going into detail with the jobs you have done.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The MCIP program has a fantastic interview process. You meet with a few professors who they try to match you with based on interest and you also get a lot of time with current graduate students during the recruitment weekend.
Interview Questions: Describe a research project you worked on that challenged you and how did you overcome they challenge.

title: Exceptional Student Educator Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: One on one with the person in charge of the museum education department. They meet with you and ask you questions, but they know everyone applying is in college so it’s not very challenging.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Design Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by multiple staff members in the office. The interview lasted about 5-10 minutes. They accepted me as an intern the day of through email. Staff members were super kind throughout the process.
Interview Questions: Q: What are your strengths and weaknesses? Tell me about yourself. What are your past design experiences?

title: Community Service Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview will start with a personal description. Then the officer will ask you how to handle a case. After that, they will ask some questions about your advance like that.
Interview Questions: If you are doing an escort with an RP, and you hear some noise from some dark place. Your RP felt scared, how do you handle this case?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Seven quant questions was asked. Duration and convexity are tools that are used to manage interest rate risk, while for options, the Greeks are also used for hedging purpose. It was generally saying a very good process.
Interview Questions: Forgot what exactly is the question

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: A phone interview with 4 people. Casual environment, the staff felt friendly. Did not ask any difficult questions. Best if you are able to show your personality when answering the questions.
Interview Questions: What are your graphic design skills?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Lab position interview painless, but submit a tailored resume! I worked for the Urology Department in prostate cancer research. The professor asked me my experience in programming; sufficient background in bio or chemical engineering should be fine.
Interview Questions: How much experience did you have in MATLAB

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Technical and interpersonal interview was conducted for a work study administrative assistant position. This position was offered for undergraduate work study students. The administrative leader and one of the professors conducted the interview.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Registered Dietitian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: First interviewed with the clinical nutrition team, then with a speciality team. It was really to get to know each other. Teams were open minded and kind. I still do not know if I got the role.
Interview Questions: tell me about a time you had a difficult patient

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Very unprofessional. I received an invitation to interview and after several attempts to schedule a time with me, they just ghosted. Wish I could have gotten some notice that they were no longer pursuing me as a candidate instead of radio silence.
Interview Questions: What time are you available to meet?

title: Senior Compensation Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Had an initial phone screen with the recruiter and then was invited for a 90 min panel interview with the two hiring managers as well as a senior analyst. After the interview, one of the hiring managers told me he would follow up with me in two weeks time. It’s been two months and I have yet to hear back. Extremely unprofessional and a giant waste of time.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Student Media Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Interviewers were all very nice and professional. The questions were standard and as expected, and everyone made me feel welcome. All in all, the interview stage feels more like having a conversation.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join student media?

title: Junior Fund Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
It was about 4 weeks long process.  I ended up only have one interview total and then suddenly week and a half later they sent an email for references (3 managers, 2 others), and then followed up a few days later with a phone call to make sure I got the email and instructed me how to fill it out.  Each time I spoke with different person, so not really sure who I spoke with regarding job titles and how they played within the hiring process, besides during the actual interview, and I never spoke again with them.  Then a phone call out of no where with the job offer.

They told me up front it would take a few weeks, but were not very good at communicating the interview process and what I would be expecting of me, such as a second interview or so forth.
Interview Questions: What would make you the best candidate for this position?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: First introduce yourself. Next introduce your past research. Then answer questions about your past experience; what are some challenges and corresponding solutions. Finally talk about your future goals and plans and what you hope to gain with the position.
Interview Questions: What is your future goal in research?

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: 1 30 minute interview with the head of Zero Waste, and potential other supervisors sitting in/co-conducting the interview. Typically 7-10 questions asked total, with a period of time afterwards for follow up questions from you.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in Zero Waste in specific, and what is one thing you would change about Zero Waste on our campus?

title: RN New Grad Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UCLA in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Three person panel from the unit ( manger/assistant manager), generic interview question, set up through zoom. Interview was 30 min. Result was given few months later. The interviewer were really nice.tried to create a calm environment
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this unit?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: I had three interviews spread over four months and was asked to do a lengthy (unpaid) skills assessment. Two months after my third interview I received an email saying I was not selected for the position.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my technical and substantive experience as it related to the position.

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: First round screening phone call, second round in person panel interview with 3 directors related to department. Average questions, review job experience and how to handle situations that may arise.
Interview Questions: How do you handle employees who have been working there a long time and are opposed to change?

title: Gallery Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Via Zoom, they asked a few questions about our background and then proceeded to ask about our availability. Then, they scheduled a meeting in real life in the Hammer Museum to further investigate our legal backgrounds by verifying our VISA and Passports.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with art?

title: Philanthropy Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Great process, multiple interviews including the board of directors, and the greater Hillel International. There were 4 interview rounds overall and each one entailed asking about a different component of the job description and my experience and ability to do the job.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength?

title: RN Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Short Zoom interview explaining the position and asking about qualifications.  Interview was with the person the job would report to. I was given a 20 minute time slot. We talked a little longer than the 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your work history.

title: Engineering Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA (Remote) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, interviewed with the board of other college students and the director. The questions were very with in the range of normal and was a group interview so multiple people were asking questions.
Interview Questions: What would make you a good fit for this role.

title: Website Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Fast email response after applying. There were two rounds of in-person interviews: one with senior employees and one with the supervisor. Asked standard interview questions and took approx 40-60 minutes each. Overall, great experience.
Interview Questions: Talk about a position in your resume

title: Department Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Two Interviews and one was with the managers. Then there was on with professors. They asked several questions that did not seem to relate to the position. The professors asked better questions than the managers.
Interview Questions: What do you think you will bring to the department.

title: Program Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Two initial interviews with management followed by a group interview with management and someone in an executive position. All interviews tanged from thirty to sixty minutes. A total of three interviews.
Interview Questions:
Q: Experience with statistical coding.
Q: Experience with SAS
Q: Examples of being detail oriented.

title: Summer Program Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: They asked about my experience working with high schoolers, my proficiency with all of the subjects being taught, and my organization and timeliness. They seemed most concerned with whether or not I would mesh with the already selected employees.
Interview Questions: What is your go-to karaoke song?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with both primary investigators on the project and submitted a few writing samples of similar work. They asked about research interests and how this fit in with my long term plan
Interview Questions: Why is this project a good fit for you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview questions, regarding strengths and weaknesses, and inquired about future research interests. Quite formal and asked to expand on the experiences mentioned in resume. Conducted online due to the pandemic
Interview Questions: What do you bring to the table?

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Very typical - phone screen and then an on-campus presentation on the prompt they assigned and panel interview. Panel interview was first and then presentation. Found the process very standard and easy to navigate!
Interview Questions: Can you tell us about a time you had to manage competing priorities from different stakeholders?

title: Fund Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The interview process can be challenging. It's important to know UCLA systems and/or other University systems to help understand how Fund Managers function in the school. It is important to be knowledgeable, but also show a willingness to figure things out.
Interview Questions: What interests you about this position?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: There was 2 rounds of interview and the first one was with the hiring manager and the second one was with the head director. They asked behavioral questions along with technical questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your work experience.

title: HR Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Structured and multiple layers. It speaks a lot about the culture of the organization that is mostly bureaucratic. Many people experienced the same and follow ups are rare. Given the positionI applied for, I received some updates once in a while from a fellow HR person.
Interview Questions: Prior experience, knowledge about the subject.

title: GSR Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very simple, one interview asking simple behavioral questions about past employment history and relevant skills. After the interview, they called to provide an offer and the salary expectations. There wasnt a negotiation process.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Screening interview was conducted over the phone. Behavioral and case interview was done in-person at the office (before the COVID-19) pandemic. The interviewers asked common questions and ensured that I was prepared for the role.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time?

title: Frontline Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with supervisor and leading manager over zoom. Group interview with one other interviewee. It was a professional, but relaxed interview since the supervisor and manager were welcoming. Only one interview and then learned whether or not I got the job some time after.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite museum?

title: Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Long but rewarding. I did several interviews as well as submitting supplemental information. They were lenient with technical difficulties in the submission of materials that they required for the continuation of the interview process.
Interview Questions: How long have you used SAS.

title: Assistant Professor, Tenure Track Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview with 6 interview panelist. Very intimidating and no room for small talk because of time restraints. Each panel member asked a question. I felt pressed for time and may not have answered as best as I could due to the pressure
Interview Questions: Research, Service, and teaching. Questions about department restructuring.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: After attending a research orientation for undergraduates, I was able to network with other graduate students/PIs after the presentation was over. I was eventually scheduled an interview with a PhD student and was asked generic questions about my research interests, the reasons on applying for this particular lab, and etc. After a day or two, the graduate student messaged me and assigned a calendar to register for future lab meetings.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in joining X lab? Why are you interested in conducting research?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Miami, FL) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: First, I had to do Power Point Presentation on the relevant topic followed by the 40-mins interview over the zoom. It was with three other board members and then 10-mins for the discussion.
Interview Questions: Previous work experience and certification in the related areas

title: Licensed Acupuncturist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was an in person interview on campus. Parking was easy as were directions. The staff was nice and friendly. Required all of my references fill out a form  and took many weeks to reply after the initial interview about filling the position.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with acupuncture.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was very nice and easy to talk to, the interview process was very straight forward. After doing the initial interview I got a call back asking to do a second interview and they were very interested in my past experience and also allowed me to be trained on the job for certain research protocols
Interview Questions: How would past research experience help you in this job field?

title: Project Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Great place to work, very professional, the interviewer was great and easy going,  asked easy questions, this was like 10 years back so I would love to help others out who are seeking opportunities at UCLA
Interview Questions: Whats your strengths and weakness

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Large panel interview with about 7 questions. Scenarios, and general questions found in most interviews. There is only one interview and you are called with a job offer within two weeks.
Interview Questions: What resources are you aware of on campus? How would you help students who have been dismissed? What would you do to increase community for Latinx, LGBTQ+, communities?

title: Parking Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was extremely informal and a simple conversation outside of the hospital. It went well and was not too hard. Additionally, the interviewer was kind and straightforward about the position.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: First, your resume is reviewed. Then, you are interviewed. Then, you complete an assessment. Then, you receive an offer if you pass the interview and assessment. The assessment is a take home coding assignment.
Interview Questions: Create a website in 3 days

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Great and enriching experience during the whole time there.  Would highly recommend people and friend to go to UCLA and receive marvel education and training. In the meantime, the process is smooth and great.
Interview Questions: What would you expect to achieve in this place?

title: Park Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Quick! They pretty much just ask if you have any experience with greeting and customer service. Talked about availability weekdays and weekends. They talked about the different duties that come with the position. If the description for, they start talking about your availability
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience with customer service and handling money?

title: Advanced Research Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Single interview with two people, asked questions related to the job and pedagogy philosophy.  Asked teaching scenarios and to describe an EDI challenge I had overcome. Asked to reflect on my high school experience and what Would chose to impart on students in order to prepare them for college.
Interview Questions: What did you not learn in high school that you wish you did?

title: ER Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process. I met with two managers and they asked me questions about my experience. I can tell from the interview that it’s great place to work. Thankfully, I got the job.
Interview Questions: Why you do want to work healthcare?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: I was directly admitted, then was asked with few questions: What is the major obstacles you had in your previous study?  How could you overcome it? What you learned from this challenge?
Interview Questions: What is the major obstacles you had in your previous study?  How could you overcome it

title: HR Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Very standard interview where you meet with the hiring manager and discuss your previous experience and how you would benefit the company. The interview itself was not too hard and the hiring manager was very open about the position.
Interview Questions: Q: What are some of your strengths and what are some of your weaknesses?

title: Customer Service Representative (CSR) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The interview itself was good and I enjoyed working for this company. It was a good experience. I learned a lot about what is like to provide an excellent customer service.
Interview Questions: What is your availability or schedule?

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions:
The executive engaged in the normal conduct of business devotes much of his time to interviewing. However, there is an appalling lack of effort given to systematic attempts at building improvements into this age-old process. Interviewing remains one of those activities which we think we know all about merely because we have been doing it so long; we have been lulled by habit. It seems apparent that a modest effort aimed at an analysis of our interviewing techniques would yield generous returns.

In the broad sense, interviewing is the process whereby individuals (usually two) exchange information. The individuals may be concerned with a job opening, a promotion, a special assignment, a product sale, information for intelligence purposes, a proposed merger, or other questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself please?

title: PIC Reader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Got an email, submitted the application and answered several questions. Just had to meet the professor/TA to discuss how they wanted the work graded and do some training afterwards on COVID protocols, ethics, etc.
Interview Questions: What courses have you completed?

title: Lead Mechanical Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (UCLA, CA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: I first sent emails to the professors and the tas. I also sent out an application in those emails as well as a cover letter. After i spoke with the ta and answered some questions and got an offer.
Interview Questions: Why would do you feel you suit this position.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions:
First had to submit an application package with a resume and a cover letter.
I was then contacted for an interview. I heard back from them with the offer in a few days.
Interview Questions: What makes you qualified for this position?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Good contacted to schedule an interview then went to ucla hr and interviewed with an individual. The process was easy and smooth and the workers are welcoming. Hesr back in  one to two weeks
Interview Questions: If a patient status changed rapidly what do u do

title: RN NURSE Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward interview process, good email communication before the interview, during the hiring process and expectations were clearly explained. Good communication from the hiring team and answered all questions clearly.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you would be a good fit?

title: Conssessions, Usher, Projectionist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions:
- Filling out the application for the specific position
- Getting contacted by the hiring team confirming whether the application was selected
- Having an in-person interview with the hiring manager (if application selected)
- Getting contacted by the hiring team confirming the result of the interview
Interview Questions: Are you willing to work over the weekends?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: You need first to submit all application materials to the coordinator of the department that you would like to work for and wait for their further notice. Most of the department will evaluate candidates based on their application materials and recommendation letters. For others, a short interview is needed. The interview is usually casual and informal, between a faculty and the candidate.
Interview Questions: Introduce your background and how that helps you teach this class.

title: Senior LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: First you apply online and then take a personality test, followed by a phone interview, and then the next step was an in-person panel interview. Lastly, you pray you get the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, where do you see yourself 5 years from now, when can you start

title: Director of Pluripotent Stem Cell and Genome Editing Facility Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the position online via the UCLA website. I was contacted 3 weeks later via email. I had two interviews, about 3 weeks apart, both of which were online through Zoom. I am currently waiting to hear back form them.
Interview Questions:
Why would I be a good fit for the position?
Where do I see myself in 5 years?
Tell us a bit about yourself.
If a supervisor is unhappy with some results, how would you deal with the situation?
Which reprogramming method would I use?
Which somatic cell would I use for reprogramming?
Do you have lab managerial skills?

title: Social Media Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: I had two rounds of interviews one with the hiring manager and the other with another intern. I was asked about my previous experience and why I wanted to enter this field.
Interview Questions: What was your prior experience managing social media?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Quick 15 minute round table discussions with current employees and new hires. Following that was a further one on one interview with the hiring manager to go over career objectives
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job?

title: Director of Strategic Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions:
This was a frustrating interview process. While the team was friendly, I went through three interviews over the course of about two months. During that time I was often told I would hear back about the next steps by the following week, and then I would hear nothing for several weeks. 

But what bothered me most was the reasoning behind their final decision. Don't get me wrong, I don't have a problem interviewing for a job and not getting it. But after this long process, I was told they had decided to refocus their search on someone with more of a background in strategic communications and less on writing (I thought this should be obvious given the title they gave the position in the first place). 

This confused me given that I do have such a background and even shared a communications plan I had developed in the past with them - which they seemed to barely look at. More frustrating was the fact that in the early interviews I asked them when we were going to get a chance to discuss strategic communications because I had questions and ideas to share with them. They assured me I'd have a chance to bring this all up at a later time. In fact, nearly all the questions they asked me had to do with writing ability, approach to writing/communications, and how I currently promote my communications at my current institution. I felt they boxed me into a corner and then explained that corner as the reason for needing to reconduct their search.
Interview Questions: Please explain the process of how you go about promoting a story about one of your researchers at your current position.

title: Case Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position through the UCLA career website. There was also a screening survey that was required before my application was given to the hiring manager. Then, I received an email for a formal zoom interview. The interview was about 45 minutes long over zoom.
Interview Questions:
What is one project that was difficult for you to work on?
Name one time that a detail was missed during a project and how did you work to fix that missed detail? 
Why are you interested in working for TIES?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: It was very short, a total of 15-30 minutes. The lecturer working there was leaving and interviewed me to replace them. We met at the lecturer's office. There was also a teaching assistant with us during the interview. Afterwards, I met with the department chair. The chair did not ask questions, but just explained how many courses I will teach.
Interview Questions: What books do you use? What teaching methodology do you use?

title: Mailroom Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: It was a 15-ish minute interview with one of the workers. It was of average difficulty but I wasn't that prepared. I also got thrown off when the employee told me they actually usually work more hours than what the maximum said on the application form because fall is the busy season.
Interview Questions: Tell me a little bit about yourself

title: Peer Learning Facilitator for AAP Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: 30 minutes of typical interview questions about personal philosophy, experience, skills, different scenarios and 15 minutes of mock session with a worksheet you prepare beforehand while interviewers acting as students
Interview Questions: What does a peer learning facilitator mean to you?

title: Digital Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: very simple- came in with a few questions and I answered accordingly. Very nice interviewers. not intimidating at all! Would work here again. Pretty simple work environment! WOrk from home isnt ideal but the team make it easier
Interview Questions: please tell me about yourself

title: NSA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: You interview with multiple people- the number of questions lessen as the interview goes on (so you're big Qs are asked in the beginning). The questions vary; some are basic interview Qs about strengths and weaknesses, others are scenario based, and others are fun and just to get to know you. Answer honestly and with your personality- you learn all the academic stuff but you can't really learn how to be engaging and kind which are both big for NSAs
Interview Questions: What is your favorite spot on campus?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very chill and nice overall. Every one was kind and the process was pretty painless-makes sense since thi si just a work study position and the first job for alot of poeple.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you

title: Athletics Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The interview had straightforward questions and was generally relaxed in feel. Nothing particularly tricky; just show your passion for the work and why you would be a good fit in the athletics department.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for athletics?

title: User Experience Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Two round interview process: both in-person prior to pandemic with supervisors. Both interviews were centered around talking about resume experience and behavioral questions. Both interviews were approximately half an hour long.
Interview Questions: Talk about your experience working in UX Design.

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: No interview process was provided and you just needed to fill out a form. Afterward, you have an orientation that is mandatory to attend that is filled with other members that got accepted.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join?

title: Admissions Officer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: It was a Straightforward interview. Asked about own resume and past experience. Wanted to see if u would stay long enough and why you were interested in a position in higher education
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past experience, why do you want to work in higher education?

title: Summer Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview went really well and every individual involved in this process were kind. It lasted about 30 minutes and it was held through zoom. There was only one person who interviewed me.
Interview Questions: Why are you choosing to pursue medicine, specifically?

title: Statistical Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions:
Easy interview.

Went over what was stated on my resume and asked a few questions about education and work experience. 

Asked about SAS programming experience in particular.

Wasn't that interested in other languages.
Interview Questions: Can you generate codebooks in SAS?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: They just want to make sure that you understand what you're researching and that you've completed the lab safety fundamentals. They also want to make sure that you have a flexible schedule.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this lab?

title: PhD In Chemical Engineering Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasted for 30 minutes. And it can be divided into mainly two parts: introducing past research work and the future research plan in the applied lab.  And the professor brought his group members to join my interview.
Interview Questions: What's your future research plan?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: it was an interview with me and three people asking me questions. they were basic interview questions, nothing stood out as particularly challenging or confusing. asked about school and background. it was in an empty classroom with the manager and two program assistants.
Interview Questions: please tell me about yourself

title: Junior Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Less than an hour and no difficult questions, but I did sense an expectation of fast turn around with designs. Other than that a lot of the questions centered around where I gain my inspiration from and examples of prior projects.
Interview Questions: How long does it take for your designs to be completed?

title: IRB Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my initial application, I first did a 15 minute phone screen with someone from human resources. Then I did a 30 minute Zoom interview with several members of the Office of the Human Research Protection Program.
Interview Questions: What qualities are you looking for in a supervisor?

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Takes so so long. Way too long to be reasonable honestly. You could be in another new jobs for months before you great back from here with an offer. So, keep that in mind before applying. Don’t think it’ll be quick. You’re in for a slog.
Interview Questions: How would your former manager describe you

title: Front Desk Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward and simple. what you would expect for this kind of position. Interviewed by 2 managers and was asked mostly about availability and shift scheduling since that's a big part of the 24 hour service job. I would highly recommend.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to work night shifts?

title: Policy Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions:
1) Phone interview with officer going into depth about my research experience, including statistics coursework taken, and field research experience mentioned on resume. (Easy)
2) Policy documents sent by mail in the morning. I was given 4 hours to extract qualitative information from documents and code it so that it could be analyzed quantitatively.  (Difficult)
Interview Questions: What is your training in quantitative research methods?

title: Staff Psychotherapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at UCLA in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews total. Initial interview with the hiring committee. One month later,  another interview with the full staff (I presented a case and discussed my therapeutic approach/interventions & staff were able to ask questions). A third interview was one month later with the leadership team.  I received an offer within one week. The process took about 2 months.
Interview Questions: How have you handled workplace conflict?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA (New York, NY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a straightforward process. It was very fast and easy to understand. The biggest problem I had was with the environment. Everything else, was great and I could have done better.
Interview Questions: What was my pas experiene?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Took about 3 weeks to get back to me. After about 3 steps you had to take before the interview. You can track your progress easily. They'll contact you through email mostly
Interview Questions: Questions were based on my previous experience as an RA

title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: They don’t really get back to you at all. They can take up to 5 months to respond to one job positing even if websites say urgent. When they do interview it’s very much like you’re disposable
Interview Questions: Why do you think you’re a good fit

title: Senior Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Really personable and kind interviewer engaged me with meaningful questions and prompts. I felt comfortable asking questions and getting to know the department as well.  I loved talking to the faculty at TFT and appreciated the candor as well of the chair.
Interview Questions: What do you feel is most important when working on new plays?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview  first about my previous work and school experiences. Apparently they were looking for vey specific expertise and did not match what they had in mind. they were looking for familiarity with specific software which I didn't have and was not familiar with.
They were nice and considerate but unfortunately they needed more of industrial experience than working on campus experiences.
Interview Questions: Questions regarding the job description and my resume

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: It was a good interview overall, I liked the people and it was nice.  I had a good experience. This was friendly and a good environment, I have no qualms.
Interview Questions: Explain what you did for your past research.

title: Volunteer Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was nice, but it needed much preparation, the doctor who interviewed me was of the same nationality so we had a better understanding. but I didn't know what was his impression, the interview was very general asking me about my goals and preferred speciality.
Interview Questions: it was about a year and half I don't remember the questions, but it was general, about goals, hobbies, and current position.

title: Software Administrative Analyst/Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I was ghosted after the interview.  No hard feelings but I did expect better from UCLA. 

The department admin reached out to schedule an interview back in October.  The following day I participated in a panel style virtual interview in which I was told at the conclusion of the interview that it be a long process and to wait 3 weeks for word.  IMO I thought the interview went really well-- they seemed to be impressed with my experience.  Due to the fact that I was told that this process would be a long one, I only followed up once with the admin that set up the interview and also exercised the patience that was asked of me.  Had it not been for me checking the portal I would have never found out in December that I didn't get the position.  Very disappointing.

Good luck to all job seekers!
Interview Questions: Be prepared to quantify your experience.

title: Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview in 3 stages. Easy to get through the initial HR screening. Then met with departmental staff and then with senior level staff. A typical institutional process. Adding text for additional 30 words.Adding text for additional 30 words.Adding text for additional 30 words.Adding text for additional 30 words.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position? What are your strong sides. Typical questions.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I found the job on the UCLA website and sent in my resume. I didn’t hear anything for quite some time but then got a phone call from the department that would be hiring me.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about your background?
Why do you want this job?

title: Custodian Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Asked very typical interview questions. Online application was very long. Communication about parking sucked and it was hard to find the building location.  Blah blah blah blah blah blah blah blah
Interview Questions: What made you apply for this job?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process involves turning in Cover Letter and Application. 2 interviews with the Department head and the Student Officer. Ask overall about your background, your skill, and experience. Gave an overview of the position.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a student wants to turn in their assignment late?

title: Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Interview went smoothly and easy question from former staff. Everyone (students who used to be peer mentors) were so nice and understanding. The whole process took less than 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you showed leadership.

title: Radio chemistry Prep Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Albuquerque, NM) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview. Very short, was asked basic questions and about myself. The interviewer answered questions as well. I think they did an okay job at explaining the position and everything that was involved.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you’re qualified for this job?

title: Office Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Was pretty easy. There was a group interview and only 2 people talked and asked questions, the rest of them never asked anything and their camera was off. Overall it wasn't too bad and difficult.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Are you feeling comfortable to work with people who are having covid

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: I have three rounds of interviews by the different people asking questions about research experiences and interests.  They also asked why chose this school.  They are really nice and the interview is not very hard.
Interview Questions: what's your research experience

title: Part-Time Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with the department chair. The interview lasted about 30 minutes and it was quite casual. The questions were easy, it was about a specific course I applied for.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching philosophy?

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: It was a simple behavioral interview. The interview process is what you would expect at any office. I applied to the office with my resume and answered a couple of short answer questions along with my work availability.
Interview Questions: Strengths and Weaknesses

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed for an initial phone interview, then I was invited for a Zoom interview since it was during COVID. They asked quite common questions for any type of interview. I never heard back after though.
Interview Questions: Why am I interested in the specific research, how do I prioritize tasks

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Simple, straightforward process. I met with my future supervisor after sending my resume to the director and we talked about expectations for the job. They reached out a week later offering me the position
Interview Questions: What particular strength do you have that you think will help working here?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Filled out online application, and was called in for one in person meeting about a week later. The in person meeting was with associate director and myself.  I got offer for internship via phone.
Interview Questions: why do you want to be an intern here?

title: Data Entry Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straight forward and simple. They were very accommodating because I was out of the state at the time, so they allowed us to have a video interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: ARD Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Rough because they require you use the star method which can really complicate things and throw off the natural answer you would originally give. I don't know why it requires 30 freaking words.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was all online. It was a lot of the same questions you have to fill out for other jobs.  Name, address, past experience, references, etc. east but time consuming.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted application online, heard back for an interview a month later. Phone interview went well, and was invited to a second interview in person. Drove all the way to campus (don't live close), had to pay for parking and the interviewer was 15 mins late. Had the interview with who would have been my boss and also with his boss. Went ok, waited a week and got called for a third interview. Was given an assignment to work on as well, that I would have to present in the interview. Drove again all the way over there for the third interview, paid again and once again they were late. 45 mins late this time. Finally get in the interview, present the work, don't recieve any feedback. It was a panel interview with four people. Finished and headed home.

 Thought I would hear something back within a week since they were pretty good on communication previously. They didn't call or email so I sent a follow up. Radio silence. At this point I know I won't receive a response. Personally, it's disrespectful to invite me for the interviews and then act like I don't deserve a response. I spent a lot of time driving there and back both times and spent time on the assignment, the least you can do is let me know I didn't get the job. Feel like I dodged a bullet. I've had enough of bad culture at my current job, don't need it in future ones.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work at UCLA?
Why do you want this job?
How did you learn about this job?

title: Family Medicine Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: There is free parking on the street. Very straightforward one day interview getting to know staff, and the local patient population, which included a tour around the entire clinic. Straightforward questions and very sweet staff. Not much more to include regarding how the day went as it was easy.
Interview Questions: Name a difficult patient interaction.

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: it was a fairly easy process. You were asked basic questions about your availability. You were asked about your interest in the position. You were asked about previous work experience as well.
Interview Questions: What previous work experience do you have?

title: SRA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Interview was straightforward. They gave a tour of the lab, explained the project role, how long they expected to fill the role, and asked me standard interview questions.
Interview Questions: What are your future goals?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: application open for one week for the winter and summer programs. you receive an email for panel interview with 2-3 managers behavioral question very nice managers if you get the job they call you if they you dont you receive and email
Interview Questions: tell us about yourself

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very casual. They mostly asked me about my work habits and style in addition to why I wanted the position. They also asked me to provide a few examples of my past research experience.
Interview Questions: How do you like to be managed?

title: Accountant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Review is for the Anderson School of Management, Business Office
Applied - 12/11/19 (On UCLA career site)
Phone Interview - 12/19/19 Received email for phone interview on 12/18/19
The interviewer, Finance Manager, was real business like not too much general or friendly conversation, which I guess may be understandable. Most of the interview involved description of the position and different functions. I was given the opportunity to go into detail about my prior experience. While I am not a accountant by trade many of my skills as a budget analyst overlap. I was experienced but the interviewer was able to focus mostly on the piece that I was not familiar with unfortunately. I was told that they were going on winter break and in person interviews would be set up after the new year (after 01/03/19). I never received a call, which was expected. Checked the application status online mid January and the position was filled. I suck at phone interviews for the most part. Ha! Hope the timeline helps but it may have been accelerated due to the holidays and winter break.
Interview Questions: Questions were based on skills and duties. No personality type questions were asked.

title: Campus Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Group interview asking 6 questions all from a different category, with some being fun light hearted questions and some more serious. Each person gets a different question so there is no repeating and everyone is pretty nice. I found it a bit unfair to some when some people were asked dull and boring questions whereas other were asked easy questions
Interview Questions: Give us your brief tour guide introduction

title: Senior Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Santa Monica, CA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions:
1. I applied on the UCLA career website line
2. Got a call from AnotherSource, a recruiting agency representing UCLA. 
3. I had a screening phone interview with them and then 
4. Moved on to an on-site interview with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working overtime?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: If you are applying to a psychology lab, you will most likely speak with a graduate student or a post-doctoral researcher. They will ask a series of questions related to the lab's research and their publications. Ensure that you are up-to-date with their publications and have read the materials.
Interview Questions: Q: Why do you want to become a research assistant at X Lab?

title: BruinCorps Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was based on personal questions along with a scenario based question. They gave a math problem and had me show how I would teach the student the best way to solve the problem.
Interview Questions:
What is your weakness?
How well do you work under pressure?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UCLA in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: My interview with UCLA as a student worker consisted of very basic interview questions. The interviewers were very nice though and it was very casual. They made me feel comfortable
Interview Questions: What is your availability like

title: IT Support Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA (UCLA, CA)
Interview Descriptions: In-person interview through another undergraduate friend who was already employed there. Easy-going, not overly formal, abstract questions.  The boss and two supervisors sat me at a round table and we had more of a get to know you discussion rather than a make or break interview.
Interview Questions: Say a caveman had just walked out from under his rock for the first time in thousands of years, how would you describe the internet to him?

title: Contracts Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the job a couple of years ago and decided to never apply for a career at UCLA again. The process took about a month. I applied in July and had a phone interview in August. I was asked very odd questions during the interview. For example the interviewer asked me what the current Bid Limit is (which is something I have experience working with). This was odd to me because the position  I applied for had nothing to do with bid limits or public works projects. Its almost like the interviewer was trying to see if I really did the work outlined in my resume (which I in fact do). title: College Academic Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2019

title: Executive Assistant Interview

title: Business Office Coordinator (Film&Television Archive) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online
In-person 1 on 1 interview
In-person second round 1 on 1 interview
Ok first off I applied to this position 6 months ago. After checking my app status online I learned my app was not selected to move on in the selection process.
Come December, I was contacted to interview for the same position (now temporaey, with lower pay). I denied.
Come January, I was contacted again to interview for FT permanent position. At this point I'm thinking, something is off. I gave it a shot.
Brief in-person interview with CFO. My first thought he's mean and unorganized. I found this person to be disengaging and interested. I found the experience to be extremely rude and unprofessional I withdrew my application.
UCLA being a "top notch" school, should provide nice working space for it's employees. This particular department was messy. Coming from a previous Cal State employee, I'd rather much stay at Cal State with my organized, clean, and respectful colleagues. After all, UCLA is just a name.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work in this department?
What do you know about this department?
What is payroll?
Weaknesses and strengths

title: Policy Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online for a Policy Analyst position with World Policy Analysis Center. I received an email about a month later to schedule a phone or in-person email (nice to have the choice). I elected for an in-person and met with 3 team members at once. The interview was extremely dry, and all three seemed very intent on being as formal and serious as possible, even much more so than other interviews I've had in fields like management consulting. Most of the questions were about my experience with both qualitative and quantitative research, my experience using different statistical packages, my comfortability with writing and policy analysis etc., as well as questions about my language expertise. Some of the questions did not make sense to me, and they didn't seem to want to explain when I asked, but i believe some of them lacked experience interviewing.

After a few issues with communication, which they were very patient over, they sent me a timed assignment to complete at home. The work was fair and probably very similar to the job itself. I felt that I had done a decent if imperfect job, but I never received any feedback. I continued to contact the office for updates weekly, but I received a rejection email 2 months after the process began. As I usually do, I emailed back just to ask why I had been passed over, simply to help me in my job search, but they never responded (it's usually 50:50 anyway). While the process was extremely long and lacked transparency, that is probably to be expected at a large university, and the coordinator was always good at getting back to my calls and emails.
Interview Questions: Explain the methodologies that you have used in your research.

Interview Descriptions: Group interview with 5 others people. They talked about the job and then ask questions. We had to speak by ourselves, listen and communicate with the others candidates. At the end, they immediatly told us if we were hired.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted via phone to schedule an in-person interview. The interview last 45 minutes to an hour with at least 15 minutes consisting of the interviewer telling me how low the pay would be and how stressful the department was. I was given a writing test at the end of the interview, and was called back two days later for a second in-person interview. The second in-person interview was disorganized and consisted of me facing a panel of the entire department; they each posed questions though no one was moderating so there were some long pauses between questions and answers. There was one interviewer present who did not seem to like my experience or answers and her body language, facial expressions, and responses were off-putting; the other interviewers were either friendly and engaging, or passive.  The second interview  lasted for 30-45 minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you overcame a challenge; tell me three adjectives that describe you and give me an example for each one; what makes you qualified for this position; internal policy-specific questions that anyone who wasn't a UCLA employee would not know the answer to.
