Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: New Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions:
- Lengthy Application consisting of around 3-4 essay questions
(Need to be in good academic standing to qualify to even apply)
- Followed by 4 rounds of situational and behavioral questions
- Some get called back for another group/panel interview
Interview Questions: Q: If you were hit on my a student, what would you do?

title: Financial Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (UCLA, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Great process friendly people intellectual environment good location fair wages good culture training available variety of ages in staff flexible hours ergonomic work space awesome benefits mental health time off
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Santa Monica, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very long. I had to do one phone interview. 2 in person interviews and a computer test. There's two orientations that are mandortory. But everything seems very promising and rewarding. Patiences is the key:
Interview Questions: Tell me something that's not on your resume

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Questions with lab director in determining researching strengths and goals and which project would best fit your interests and help you in your career. Also, usually a tour of the lab to help you figure out layout. Team members may or may not be present during interview
Interview Questions: What are your research interest and strengths?

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: you take a survey and then go in for the interview. the recruiter was very asked a couple of questions and then asked questions of a list she had. interview lasted about 20 to 30 min.
Interview Questions: is the patient always right

title: Customer Service Representative At Chief Technology Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: They were accommodating to not having work experience as a student. Good place if you need a resume starter but it is intensive because of the nature of call center work. Way better than others on campus
Interview Questions: Mock phone conversation

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Porter Ranch, CA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied and the same day the hiring manager called to set up an interview, after the interview it took quite a long time to hear back from them, about three weeks.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for UCLA?

title: Student Support Technicican Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: Relaxed, easy going, professional, casual. I was asked several questions about how I would approach a problem and what I would do to fix it. They also asked a few riddles to see my thought process.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in this position?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was highly enjoyable. They flew us out for a weekend in LA and put us up in a posh hotel and fed us very well.  We saw presentations from current students and got to meet with a variety of PIs that we requested from a list.  Each interview with the PI was informative and they were all very willing to discuss their work and provide insights into life and work at UCLA.
Interview Questions: They asked about my research experience

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very nice and very personable for everyone Something I loved about is that they made me feel at home.  They made me realize that this was a great place to work at.
Interview Questions: What I could bring that was different from others.

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a call for a phone interview. Once screened then, I was booked for a in person interview with two of the hiring agents. I was sent an email, to bring the necessary items. I have the interview tomorrow and I am excited and nervous.
Interview Questions: Asked what my role was, and how I deal with my co-workers.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I sent in my application online. They called me a few days later after I sent in my application and set up a time and date for the in-person interview. I schedule an interview within that week.
Interview Questions: What are your future goals?

title: IT Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: One on one in person interview. Questions about resume looked at some projects on my resume, and asked a coding problem. They were looking for previous experience with the technologies they used or something closely related so that you could learn their technologies quickly.
Interview Questions: write a function that prints the 10 most frequently used words in a string.

title: Technology Transfer Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The phone interview was with a contracted 3rd party who does screening interviews for UCLA.  The interviewer made it clear that it is going to be a screening interview.
Interview Questions: Why UCLA

title: Software Engineer(Internship) Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The inteview process consisted of two stages: (1) The behavioral questions (and resume review) interview, which lasted about 30 minutes, and (2) the technical interview, where I was asked several low level C questions.
Interview Questions: Tell us of a time where you had to work with difficult coworkers. How did you handle the situation?

title: Administrative Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: simple process, phone interview/screen with HR.  interviewed with 4 different people on sight.  had to take a written exam, which was fairly easy.  asked a variety of different questions, some were behavioral some were based on my experience.  Met finally with the director, who was very friendly.  didn't ask too many difficult questions.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Senior LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: First interview with 2 people one from hr and one rn. after 1 week received a call and scheduled me for a 2nd interview. Second interview after 2 weeks from first interview. Next, they called me to do live scan,physical exam and skill test. got called again to give me vaccines after 2 days.  3-4 days had passed they emailed me asking for 3 professional reference. after 3 working days they made verbal job offer through phone and emailed me a formal job offer by the end of the day! about 1 month process all in all.
Interview Questions: why ucla?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Brief and easy as it was a work study position, asked basic behavior questions and asked if I had a basic background in accounting. Asked if I was willing to learn new softwares and willing to commit about 20 hours a week to this position.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the long run?

title: Graduate Student Affairs Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was on the phone. They invited me the next day to meet with the department manager and the person I spoke with on the phone. Interview was fairly easy, very general and basic questions. I was offered the job at the end of the week via email.
Interview Questions: It was basic interview questions and asking about my previous experience in my previous institution. They asked about team work and asked about a time I had to take ownership on a project and how I was able to succeed.

title: Senior Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I first went through a phone interview. Then got an email asking for in person interview. First, I met with a manager and then other team members fellowed in the interviewing process.
Interview Questions: what is a time series.

title: Student Worker At Bruin Café Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: filled out a hard-copy application and delivered it to a manager at Bruin Café; heard back about eight months later; interviewed--basic questions about customer service, what recommendations I would give for additional menu items, etc.
Interview Questions: What would you add to our menu?

title: Technology Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: First step was an initial phone interview.  Followed-up with an on-site interview.  After the on-site, called back for a more extensive on-site that involved meeting several key personnel and having mini-interviews with each.
Interview Questions: Besides the generic type of interview questions, I was asking several questions to "test" my computer knowledge.  For example - an employee is traveling abroad for a conference and wants to take their laptop and phone with them.  How do you handle this request?

title: Student Valet Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: They asked about my class schedule and that's it. It was pretty easy. Everything went by super fast and I got an offer in which I accepted. After all, it is just a student job at UCLA. They prefer if you have work study.
Interview Questions: What are your class schedule?

title: Senior Legal Post Interview
Application Type: The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Candidates are screened by Korn Ferry in a professional manner. They attempt to broaden scope of pool called in for interview but UCLA  Has very firm expectations , especially around fit with various constituencies. Probably independent and leading edge types need not apply (nor would they be happy).
Interview Questions:
What do you think the school’s highest legal /complianceresponsibilities should be this coming year? How would you resolve a conflict of inquiries from 
Faculty and administration? Hat is your work style? How will integrate the 24/7 on call nature of job with your life?

title: Student Assistant YRL Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was really easy! I was surprised at how nice my interviewer was (my supervisor) and even though she came thirty minutes late, she apologized and the interview went rather quick. Not difficult at all and I would recommend applying before the summer since I assume it is less competitive to get an interview. They basically told me their expectations they have from me and job duties.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The job position required an in-person interview concerning on the job cases.  These cases would often review how a mentor would approach and handle situations with multiple individuals involved.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a case in which two students refuse to cooperate with each other?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds of interview 1st : behavior 2nd : behavior 3rd: technical. Interviewee was very kind and helpful however I had to use the program language I never had experience in
Interview Questions: analyze the given dataset and make a presentation out of your finding

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: The manager was friendly and ushered me in to talk. There was some assessment of my team work ability and he asked about what hours I preferred. The were basically hardly any requirements. One just has to be agreeable.
Interview Questions: Previous experience, temperament and preferred timings.

title: Library Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The interview was straightforward. It was a almost an informal panel interview, the interviewers were friendly and took turn asking questions of how my experience related to the position, and how familiar I was with their processes.
Interview Questions: How would you react if one supervisor comes up to you and tells you do something, and then another supervisor later makes a different request?

title: Accountant II (Accounting & Cash Management) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by the department within a week of submitting an online application. She asked for a phone interview the same day (she emailed at 11am and asked to chat after 3pm). 

The interview took 30 minutes. She went through a list of questions and it wasn't engaging at all. 

I sent a thank you email the same day and heard back from her right away.
Interview Questions: Walk me through your resume. Why are you leaving your current job? What's your weakness? What do you not like about your current position? Do you have any experience in ledger reconciliation? How well do you know Excel? How are you different than other candidates?

title: PICU Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at UCLA in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: There were two separate interviews. The first one was with two assistant managers in one of the UCLA office buildings. The second was a two part interview. One with a panel of nurses, the other with the manager of the unit. It ended with a tour of the unit as well.
Interview Questions: All was very behavioral based. A big one was why the PICU!

title: Staff Research Associate III Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: In academic research setting, individual lab principal investigator interviews the applicant so interview process can vary. My interview was easy since I previously worked in the same department department as the principal investigator.   There were no additional interviews with the management team of the department.
Interview Questions: Why your skill sets are important for the job.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got a phone call for a in person interview. Interview in person. Job Offer. It was test that I had to take before the discussion of the position. Then the normal questions. What pay was I looking for. It all took about 45 minutes. I was called a month later for drug and background check, which took another month. Then is was orientation.
Interview Questions: What are you strengths and weakness?

title: External Affairs Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a very short, simple set of questions about involvement on campus and interest in assisting in the advancement of the university.  Largely the process involved getting to know the candidates and judging their capacity to work in a client-facing capacity.
Interview Questions: What does UCLA mean to you?

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I turned in my resume, and the same day I was given a call to come in for an interview.  A student manager asked me a few standard questions about my resume/experience.  (I didn't have experience in food service, but in the end, I still got the job.)  I dressed business casual, but I don't know if that was necessary.  After leaving the interview, I was given another class at 9 o'clock that same night to talk to the actual manager.  We talked for over an hour about random things, and then he told me I got the job.
Interview Questions: Name five qualities that you have that will convince me to hire you straight away.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I got my phd degree from UCLA and I was interviewed by a committee (3 people). It is an on-site interview and those interviewers are very nice. You will get reimbursement for everything.
Interview Questions: Why you choose UCLA and this department?

title: Pharmacy Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was easy but the question in a survey they issued were unethical and didn't make sense. They use these questions that are very repetitive in the survey so that you don't understand what they truly saying. It basically playing a mind game with you so you don't get hired.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, got a first interview, then got a second. The second interview is to meet my boss' boss. Then afterwards I believe there's a skills test to see how proficient you are with microsoft office. i knew beforehand the process would take a while, but the wait is definitely worth it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UCLA.

title: Economics Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed once over video conference with a number of different employees within the organization. For the most part, they asked general behavioral questions and a resume walk through. It's not a difficult process and only takes a few days in total.
Interview Questions: Speak about a time that you dealt with an irate client.

title: Title IX Investigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UCLA (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my materials and got a call a few months later. Then an interview was scheduled.  I was told this may be the only interview (no multiple rounds), which sounded odd. They wouldn't fly me out so I interviewed by video. They required me to do a presentation and I felt at a disadvantage being on video, which I expressed prior to the interview. I found out a couple weeks later that I was a finalist, and references and a writing sample were requested. Several weeks went by. I asked for an update - twice.  I was told a decision was imminent.  I found out that evening I was not selected.  I don't think they ever intended to hire me and wouldn't be surprised if there wasn't an internal candidate.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position.

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: First is the phone interview with your employer. Then you have an in person interview in a few days. The interview is a panel of multiple staff or including other department heads. Be prepared for specific questions.
Interview Questions: Why did you specifically choose this company.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Took a long time. People are very nice and proud of the university. Seems to be plenty opportunity to move around and develop. Good benefits are offered. Company seems to appreciate employees with experience regardless of age.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this job now?

title: Full Time Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UCLA (UCLA, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was an individual interview with five of their employees and Took about and hour. This was my first ever interview in my professional field so I didn't know what to expect. The interviewers were very nice and the questions being asked were pretty general. In the last 15 mins they started asking me technical questions and they where not that hard either.
Interview Questions: You said you have taken algorithm classes, tell me what you think the Big-O would be for this piece of code.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: One of my friends worked here and sent me the information for the job. I emailed my resume and cover letter to manager in charge. Scheduled an interview a few days later. I interviewed with two people.
Interview Questions: They asked me about myself, how my friends would describe me, my greatest accomplishment, my strengths, my weaknesses, why I wanted to work there, how the job related to my career goals, etc.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was called one week after submitting my online application for a phone interview. I received an invitation for an in person interview the next day. When I arrived to the interview I was given a computer task to complete. After I completed that task, an interviewer stepped in to show me a new task to complete. Finally I was taken to a conference room where I was interviewed for what felt like an eternity. The questions were endless and every question had a follow up question and another follow up question. I felt like I was interviewing for a government job.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Rersident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: First you apply online in December. Then they get back to you in January and you do 2 group interviews over 2 weeks with 10 or so other candidates. You do projects where you design programs and talk about incidents. Lastly in early February, you'll do a round-robin style of interview where you spend 5 minutes each at 5 tables to talk about certain topics like Programming, Policy Enforcement. etc.
Interview Questions: Describe the role of an RA, and your strength and weaknesses related to the position.

title: Policy Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had an in-person interview with 2 people. It lasted about half an hour. Pretty much all of the questions were behavioral ones. The next step was a coding data test. I completed the test and sent it in, but I never heard from them again.
Interview Questions: They wanted to know what kind of quantifiable research I'd done in the past.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The process took two weeks, first interview was by phone second face to face. The questions were straight forward. The interviewers were really nice and overall interview went pretty smooth. Got hired right away and pretty excited to be working with great people!!
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in UCLA?

title: Director of Events Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: About a month long process (pretty quick for a University process actually).  The hiring manager was very informative and kept me updated throughout the entire process.  I had a phone interview first followed by a Skype interview and then a third phone interview.
Interview Questions: Situational and behavioral questions

title: Patient Concierge Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: At UCLA Ashe Center, it was a group interview with three other people.  The person asking the question was nice and asked basic questions of how you could contribute to the team.
Interview Questions: How can you make people feel welcome?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was approached for my involvement in a alumni group that a current employee was part of. Afterwards, I engaged in a very brief conversational phone interview regarding the scope of the position and was probed to see if I was interested. Afterwards, I met twice with my eventual supervisor to outline the specifics of the role and what my day-to-day mission would be.
Interview Questions: How do you envision the program running on a day to day basis?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Apply then got interviewed. I directly talked with the director of graduate study in the department of pharmacology and got accepted into the pharmacology program. The question I have is relatively simple and they have been nice to me on my application.
Interview Questions: why do you apply for UCLA?

title: Valet Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Boring and simple. Unforntusky I did not get the job because I thought it was not right for me. The lady was nice and simple question. I could have got hired but I decided not too
Interview Questions: What is your favorite color

title: Project Manager - Facilities Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Submit your resume online, you will receive a call back if you are chosen. 3 person panel. Technical Interview. They read questions from a list. You must know construction, or it will show.
Interview Questions: Technical

title: Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: it was a smooth process and they asked relevant questions to the work that would be performed. I would recommend the job to another colleague  because it was a great experience
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Talk with the professor, and discuss one some basic research projects that I did before. Also we discussed on some current popular research area. Furthermore, we discussed some papers I published before.  We also have a lunch together, in which we discussed some possible projects to do in the future, and the professor introduced me the research, and the current group research projects.
Interview Questions: Some basic algorithms

title: Assistant Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Asked the professor for a position after taking the class. He gave me the job starting the next quarter after I finished his class and I spent a while working with the post-doc student on various projects.You do have to already be a student at UCLA for it to work
Interview Questions: None

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Came in for a day long interview, thirty minutes presentation based on my previous work, 1-to-1 meeting with the PI and all lab members, thirty minutes each. I was given a tour of the lab by a staff scientist. At the end of the day I had a dinner interview  with the PI
Interview Questions: Mostly related to my research and presentation

title: Assistant Public Administrative Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by two professors during the first interview. This went really well as they were very personable and explained what the duties for the role involve. I received an invitation for a second interview about a week later as this was during thanksgiving. The second interview was really tough. I can definitely attribute my not getting the job to this interview but that is okay. The interviewer was very stern!
Interview Questions: What are your long term goals? How do you handle criticism?

title: Event Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter was very quick at responding. The interview process was very seamless and efficient. She asked about my experience with working with others and problem solving. After being accepted, they have a day for training, and then you are expected to learn on the spot with different scenarios that tend to happen.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Student Web Programmer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: I entered and was questioned about my skills and previous CS experience in college. I was then given an interview question to answer, and I talked my way through what I was thinking for the problem. I wasn't able to correctly answer the question, but they thought my process was good enough to give me an offer.
Interview Questions: What projects have you done in college?

title: Resident Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: You submit your application through a national data-base. Most applicants do a sub-internship in their 4th year of medical school to gain an advantage in the hiring process. However, this is not a mandatory requirement. The actual interview involves multiple mini-interviews with different members of the department, including current residents, faculty and the program director.
Interview Questions: Why you chose your medical specialty

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Statement of purpose, standardized exams, GRE, TOEFL scores, transcripts, strong academic profile, recommendation letters from faculty members, past research experience is a plus, no on-site or phone interviews, teaching experience is preferred for scientific positions. Definitely make sure to have open house campus visits and talk to the fellow graduate students to have a better idea on what to expect for the first few years
Interview Questions: no on-site or phone interviews

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: First is the phone screen, two person is interviewing. One is from the position related department, one is from the HR, asked about 8 questions. Typical interview questions and straight forward. Said will contact to have in-person interview within a week if the candidate is considerable. You have to know which position are you interviewing and the jobs duties. The process is within 30 mins.
Interview Questions: What do you know about this position?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process takes a long time.  However, the employer from the Math Department that I had interview with was very rude and mean.  Since I said good morning to her, she did not response and asked me to wait.  Never smiling during the interview.
Interview Questions: What do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Westwood, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: After submitting your application you will be emailed about coming in for an interview, which will likely be an informal sit down conversation.  The process is not stressful at all, and you definitely do not need to dress in a suit and tie for the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview with a small panel of senior management (3 people) that would be engaging with the hired employee on a day to day basis.  The interview focused on what skills I had that would lead me to being the best candidate for the job.  The focus was on being a team player as well as someone who can work with little or no supervision.
Interview Questions: What UCLA systems are you familiar with?

title: Access Monitor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: I asked the people for an application and turned it into Covel the next day. Got a call for an interview after a few days. They asked me questions about why I want to work there and situational questions.
Interview Questions: If someone ran through you and into the elevators, what would you do?

title: Director of Educational Media and Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The people who ran the interview, my future boss and comparable level managers, had virtually no knowledge about the job, its requirements, or the skill sets required to do the job. They had to bring in a comparable person from across campus to make any evaluations as to my abilities and expertise to do the job. Several people in the interview, I was to discover later, had little or no contact with myself or the position once I was hired. They were only in the interview for political reasons or to provide moral support or gut feeling input to the ultimate "decision maker".
Interview Questions: What is your general approach to maintenance and problem solving.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: individual interview with the hiring manager, group interview with the office mates, and individual interview with the faculty director. It takes about 3 weeks from the beginning to the end of the process.
Interview Questions: normal questions: what's your strength and weakness, what's your work experience ....similar to what's on the CV.

title: Adminisitrative Assistant for AAP Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UCLA (UCLA, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Talked to the supervisor. He asked questions about the department and whether or not I have a clear understanding of the program that I'll be working for. They want to know that there is knowledge of using Microsoft Excel, which is very important since the main item for the job is data entry for the supervisor.
Interview Questions: What is AAP?

title: Postgraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UCLA in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: I only had a skype interview, which was pretty easy. The PI asked what I did during my PhD, most challenging stuff. Whether I did the research independently? He explained a lot on his own research. He did contact all the references I provided. Got the offer the next day
Interview Questions: What is the most challenging thing you have ever encountered? How did you solve it?

title: Accounts Payable Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was called in for an in-person interview a week later. The interview was scheduled for two weeks after that. Everyone was very nice and the interview process was made easy. Typical interview and questions for position. Figured I didn't get the position since I received no call back. Checked status online and confirmed position had gone to someone else.
Interview Questions: What's your experience handling Accounts Payable? How would you handle a difficult situation with a co-worker? What's your experience working with xxx software?

title: Staff Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Wonderful...It was very easy and I truly enjoyed speaking with everybody. So they hired me. It was a long time ago. I am looking for new jobs now. I want it to be part time with a very awesome place just like UCLA where the employers actually count on you and without you nothing can be done.
Interview Questions: What did I find most challenging in my past job?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: A short (20-30 minute) interview with many (eg. 11) people from the department. Each interviewer walks you to your next meeting. They provided a list of interviewers in advance and it helped to research them in advance to know what their individual research fields were.
Interview Questions: What were your past research experiences

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Sent in resume and cover letter to the Dashew Center, was called for a group interview along with one other applicant. The questions were brutal, antagonizing and strangely political (?) for a position that likely doesn't do much beyond clerical work. There was some group work on how to resolve the "dilemma" of international students.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you're the more qualified candidate of the two of you?

title: Emergeny Trauma Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Santa Monica, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very informal, two supervisors and myself in one of their offices. They both came from working in the ER, so they were obviously busy. However, they took the time to really answer any questions I had about the position and demonstrated great interest in my past experiences. Both supervisors were friendly the entire time, and I felt quite at ease and pleased imaging what it would be like to work under them on a regular basis.
Interview Questions: Can you handle being in a pressured environment?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: This was for an entry-level position so only job requirements and schedule was discussed. My responsibilities were explained in general terms. I was introduced to everyone in the office and talked a little bit about myself and my background. Because I was referred by a previous employee, the process was very quick and not difficult at all. I was asked to do HR paperwork at the day of the interview.
Interview Questions: Which days are you available for work?

title: Administrative Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had already started here working as a temp and was then asked to apply for a permanent position. I had an interview that was pretty good with the internal HR person which was followed by an interview with my direct supervisor. It was a pretty typical interview and having any experience with internal UCLA systems is definitely helpful. Overall, they are very laid back and open to different types of people and work styles!
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you had to overcome a challenge?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Usually, we will have an onsite interview for 1-hour talk. We introduce our former research work and research plan. We have 30min to answer the questions and discuss the position research and so on. After 1 week, we can get the final results.
Interview Questions: What is your research plan in the future?

title: Travel Auditor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had one interview with Manager, which went well. Normally applicants at UCLA meet for up to 3-5 interviews. Connected with manager and was offered the position 2 days later. Very smooth and non-stressful interview.
Interview Questions: Basic top ten questions- why this job, what qualities will you bring, etc...

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process, just the normal admissions that one would have to complete and be qualified for.  For graduate school it is better to know a professor and be able to work in the lab.
Interview Questions: whats your gpa

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone call which consisted of me discussing academic background and previous research. We also discussed the current projects ongoing in the UCLA lab and which of these I would be most interested and suited to participating in. We subsequently discussed potential start dates.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous research.

title: Associate Account Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview, basic questions relating to customer management. Process consisted of a phone interview and multiple in-person interviews where I met with a total of 4 people. Overall, it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you had a difficult time dealing with a customer

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions:
You go in and sit in front of the director and they will ask you to walk through your resume.
It is very relaxed and they don't expect you to have lots of experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you lead others.

title: SAOII Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The first interview is with the directors, and they are very friendly and casual, just want to hear about job experience. if you pass this round, they will invite you to a coffee meet up with some of the employees. The process does move kind of slowly so don't worry if you don't hear back right away. Be prepared to have examples of relevant work experience. They want to see how well you can roll with things and how adaptable you are.
Interview Questions: Describe previous experiences working with diverse communities

title: Java Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied through a consultancy and they did two rounds. One was telephonic and pure technical. Second round was 1:45 mins skype call . There are 3 people including manager datta . They asked me all kind of technical questions on a complete web application. But more than checking my knowledge, I felt like they are trying to make sure I dont answer there questions and prove as if they asked very intelligent question infront of there manager.
Interview Questions: what are the uses of karaf ?  and how to configure

title: Assistant Project Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a two on 1 interview. This means there were two people alternating asking questions. All questions related to the type of work you would be doing. They emphasized on following strict access policies and how to deal with certain situations that pertained to a limited access policy.
Interview Questions: The law school library is not open to the public, how would you enforce and inform a patron who is not allowed access. According to the rules, how can you resolve the patrons issue?

title: Hospital Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Santa Monica, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: They call you for a phone interview, once you get through the phone interview they have you come in for a personal interview. My interview was in front of a panel of 4 people. They were very nice and made me feel comfortable. I was hired within a week and I started my training within a month.
Interview Questions: What kind of experience do I have?

title: Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UCLA in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: 45 minute interview with 2 of the lead project's staff.  Interview was straightforward and typical. Interview was the 2nd phase of their hiring process. Did not make it to the next phase, where candidates were emailed a "test". Was notified 2 months later via email that the position had been filled.
Interview Questions: What is your management style?

title: Medical Records Abstractor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Woodland, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was good i explained what i did and the interviewer explained what i would be working with a group. She stated that there would be a lot of work abstracting  from there computer system to care connect
Interview Questions: My experience with medical records

title: Admin Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: My memory is fuzzy now.  To the best of my recollection, online application followed by a phone call.  In person interview followed by another phone call.  Offer made and accepted.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UCLA?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Got the job by emailing a professor I had and asked if there were any postdoc opportunities. Submitted my CV along with the email. A casual lunch and meeting with other researchers. No formal interview process.
Interview Questions: There was no formal interview. We had an informal lunch and then I met with senior researchers. The senior researchers asked me basic questions about my research and what I was interested in.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (UCLA, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Presentation on current work followed by interview and chat with PI. Then followed by lab member meetings on an individual basis to learn about the projects and so they gauge your personality. Usually ends with dinner where the pi and several lab members are invited
Interview Questions: Why us

title: Peer Learning Facilitator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (UCLA, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview took about an hour. Involves many hypothetical scenario questions & a mock tutoring session. There will usually be two people present during the interview and they will be taking notes for every single question. Make sure to take the time to prepare for each answer rather than immediately vomiting out something.
Interview Questions: What would you do is a student is harassed by another student (e.g. sexually explicit comments)?

title: Parking Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very simple. They mainly hire student workers. They ask about your work experience and how you react under pressure, and how you deal with difficult costumers. The ask about you availability. Based on your school schedule, they will either place you in the morning shift or afternoon.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a difficult situation?

title: New Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview. Very brief and easygoing. Relax and express your interest and why you want to work for them as well as why you're a great fit is the best way to enter the job.
Interview Questions: What makes you different from the rest of the candidates?

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was called in for interview. Was a very upfront and run of the mill interview. Only had a couple questions that caught me off guard. Only made it to first round of interviews.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with the bureaucracy of UCLA?

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Asked basic questions regarding resume and specific experiences related to the potential job. This included technical experience as well as customer service experience. Overall was an easy interview that did not require too much prep as long as you could confidently explain your resume.
Interview Questions: Have you had any previous customer service experience?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: 5 tables - each table had two questions about a particular topic (ex. self-awareness table, programming table, policy enforcement were a few). Make sure you know a lot about Core 5 and important standards of residential life.
Interview Questions: Tell us a time where you made a mistake and what you learned, what is most important in programming (challenges), etc.

title: Staff Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: We need to interview before the job posting. The lab member did the interview for me with the supervisor. Everyone is nice and ask questions about my future plan. I would like to open one company about engineering.
Interview Questions: Why do you leave the current job.

title: Project Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It really depends on which principal investigator (PI) you would like to work for.  Most interview will require a formal powerpoint presentation.  If you will be working with the same PI, then you don't need to give powerpoint presentation.
Interview Questions: What is your postdoc work?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Meet with faculty and discuss about their research interests and also about the research environment at UCLA. Gave a 45 minute seminar and at the end met with the chief of the division to discuss in greater detail about the position.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in joining UCLA and our division?

title: Computer Support Technician At ResLife Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the campus position during their recruitment season. They then called me in for one on-site interview where I talked with a supervisor and a student computer support technician lead. I received my offer within a couple days via email.
Interview Questions: Open up a computer case and explain what each part does.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Got a phone call from my current advisor asking about my background. Not too many harsh questions, just about what I have done in my research. And he told me about the fantastic weather in LA and encourage me to go to UCLA.
Interview Questions: I do not think there is any difficult questions in the interview. The whole process is very friendly and it is basically just chatting with each other.

title: Teaching Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions:
Questions about previous Teaching experience and previous classes.
Time and commitment, communication skills
Ability to lead sections, assist professors
Give instant responses, Be helpful and show concerns
Teaching is not easy especially the professors challenge students
Try to motivate students along the way
The most important thing is to cooperate with your college TAs who's support you rely on
Try to be specific about class requirements and give students reminder in time
Try to add additional office hours when they have midterm to need to review exams.
Try to go over main points and help them learn more efficiently
Interview Questions:
Also, I would suggest to communicate very well and show gratitude to your college TAs
Try to put everything in the same email
Don't forget to check feedback. Try to talk more with your students during the class if you feel you lost their attention.

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: no interviews, but many personal statements. You can apply through ucla websites. There are more internships for Daily Bruin other than marketing. There are about 5-6 questions you have to ask for applying. I think it is more important to put your passion rather than experiences because it is college internship. They know it is hard for students having professional experiences in background.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this job? What motivated you to work at marketing field.

title: Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward. First round interview was behavioral (why do you want this job, what's a defining leadership experience, etc.) Second round interview was to work with a team to create a presentation that would be given to a hypothetical group of students. That was a bit tough, because you want to stand out but not be too dominant.
Interview Questions: Why should we hesitate to choose you?

title: Child Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: 1 interview. nice and informal yet still professional. i spoke with the director and we discussed the school, i got a tour of the school, met employees, and teachers and visited classrooms and what not. it was a nice experience and i also got to look at the schol and discusss the curriculum wih the director and things of that nature.
Interview Questions: What would you do with a difficult parent?

title: Summer Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The interview was for a undergraduate research position that opened up for the duration of the summer quarter at UCLA. I found a listing for the position online and emailed my resume and cover letter. I received a request for an interview within the week. The lab where I interviewed was affiliated with the Brain Research institute. The interview was non-formal and was conducted by the lab's PI.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question was about my experience with fMRI. Since my experience was limited and my exposure to the technique was limited to the classroom setting, I struggled.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Professional, brief, accurate and acute questions on experience; friendly people who offered refreshments before and after the interview. They had no problems with my blue hair (ultimately grew out of it) and were strictly concerned with my skills and how I could grow with the company. The main interviewer liked that I had web maintenance experience because they were replacing their website with a new one and preferred a candidate with that type of knowledge.
Interview Questions: Do you have any website building experience?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions:
asked about my education and past experience. talked about my 
enthusiasm about the job. interested in the power system and power electronics experience. the connections of EV in china helps a lot.
Interview Questions: have you been TA before?

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UCLA (UCLA, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I created a log in and applied via the student job portal on the UCLA website. I received an email offering a time for an interview. I was asked about how thoroughly I can document data and my ability to apply statistics in data management. I was also asked on how well I can delegate tasks among a team.
Interview Questions: How well I can manage my time

title: Faculty Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online as that's the only way to apply nowadays. If you want to work at UCLA, go to their careers website. I was called 2-3 weeks after I applied and was given no indication that a phone interview was going to take place at the moment. It took 20-30 minutes. I never got a call or email back about the status of my candidacy.
Interview Questions: How would you help the faculty members?

title: LAN Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very easy. The process took 2 days. You will first get interviewed by the senior lab consultants who will be your coworkers. To be honest, not much experience is necessary as long as you show enthusiasm and willing to learn. These interviewers will be the people you work with so they would want to work with someone who they like and want to work with so speak to them in friendly terms. No need to be too formal. The second interview is with the head of the computer lab. interview was pretty easy as well. The head just ask wether you are positive you want the job and give an overview of what you do on the job.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
What would you do if a student asks for help on a program you are not familiar with?

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Simple phone call after submission of online work study request. Afterwards, was invited to an interview which consisted of behavioral questions one on one  interview, got offered a second round interview with the director and another staff, then proceeded with offer
Interview Questions: Describe a time when there was a conflict you experienced and how you overcame it.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was in person with two of the store's managers. The interview went over previous experiences, asked some basic behavioral and personality questions. Asked questions that placed you in different scenarios that may occur in a retail atmosphere such as "what if the customer is unhappy?" and "what do you do if you have an issue with your coworker?"
Interview Questions: What do you do if you have a conflict with a coworker?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I was originally hired as a research assistant while getting my PhD. I basically got the job after a brief conversation in the hall. I already had a Master's degree. I continued to work at the Center for twelve years, taking on new projects. When I completed my PhD, I was given faculty status.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: I first sent my resume and actual code I wrote to professor. I have a research discussion meeting with professor and his/her students. I also had some phone interviews with his/her students too.
Interview Questions: What would you like to work

title: Lab Helper Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: interview about job, just ask questions on what kinda of person you are, what major you are and ask you about past jobs.  They then show you the lab and introduce you to everyone and introduce you to the pi.  They tell you there are chances for independent research after a year at the job.
Interview Questions: none, simple interview

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: It's a LONG process, I think it varies for each department but usually you do a phone interview, then an in person interview with various people. Questions are not hard. Campus is huge so give yourself enough time to get lost if you're not familiar with the campus.
Interview Questions: General questions, nothing out of the ordinary - "Where do you see yourself in 5 years?" "What would you say your previous employer would tell us you need to work on?" , etc.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: All applicant must apply online, and the process can take a long time to complete. This job requested a writing sample in addition to the CV and resume.The interview tried to identify personality and "cultural fit". I was contacted one week after the interview and offered the position.
Interview Questions: Explain how you would deal with competing priorities.

title: Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: hey saked about my experience and my schedule. they wanted to know how many projects i can take control of at the same time and how many things would be on my plate.
Interview Questions: experience

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: The librarian asks about my language abilities and attention to details and I gave her my past experiences. My past experiences were also checked. Then, she gave me an overview of the job.
Interview Questions: Are you a detailed oriented person? Are you proficient in Microsoft related softwares?  What's your availability?

title: Postgraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: In person interview was formal, with an emphasis on technical questions. The hiring decision was made based upon recommendation letters, personal interviews, and an overall acceptance by the group I was going to work in. In general, it was a pretty standard postdoc interview process. I think anybody interviewing here should prepare for many questions about their prior research.
Interview Questions: technical questions

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: received a call from the very friendly supervisor asking if i would be interested in doing a face-to-face interview. i had one interview with the supervisor and she was very casual and easygoing. she called me later that night with a job offer. a couple weeks later i had an orientation and my first day of training.
Interview Questions: how my previous work experience would help me with the position.

title: Project Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Set up a detailed profile on their employment site. From there applying for multiple jobs is easy. It can take a long time to get through the hiring process, from hearing back about your application, through interviews and getting an offer.
Interview Questions: Detailed questions about how I handled the termination of an employee.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Had to prepare essay questions prior to the interview. At the beginning of the interview, you had to give a pitch to introduce yourself for them to see how eloquent and genuine you are about wanting the position. Next were questions about experience, why you want the job, and questions about the organization itself. Finally came role playing which seemed intimidating at first, but mostly about keeping your cool/composure and handling business.
Interview Questions: What experiences prompted you to be suited for this position?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Application. Submission of undergraduate transcripts, degree and recommendation letters.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I sat with the Associate Director and talked about my past experience, as well as my passion for education. I gave details about past jobs that dealt directly with the research conducted at the office to which I was applying.
Interview Questions: She asked me to give details on what I learned from each previous position on my resume.

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Had a formal interview process with the principal investigator. Gave a ppt presentation to the lab, and chatted with each of them about their experiences and likes and dislikes of the lab environment. Had private conversation with the principal investigator about job expectations and scientific project to be worked on.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous work

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Department flew everyone in for a large meeting at the beginning. Every student was to meet a few professors to discuss opportunities within groups. Thereafter each interview with professors varied widely in their questions. Come prepared to discuss why their research interests you. After that, network with current grads and head home the next day.
Interview Questions: What kind of project most interests you?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Applied to a PhD program in the usual way. GRE, TOEFL, LoRs, diplomas etc. I had to go through a skype interview also. At the end, I got admitted. Now, I am in my third year.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions really. Just what I have done in the past.

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Westwood, CA)
Interview Descriptions: They use an outside company as the first point of contact and will conduct a phone interview initially.
Interview Questions: You just need to know your experience well and make it relate to the job you are interviewing for.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: The process consisted of connecting with the researcher, interviewing, and then being hired.
Interview Questions: The length of time for employment.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UCLA
Interview Descriptions: Met with manager and was offered position within a week
Interview Questions: tell a time you had to work on something difficult

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume and cover letter in response to a Bruin View job posting, and was emailed about scheduling a job interview about 2 weeks later. We scheduled a phone interview for the following week, after which I was emailed to set up an in-person interview. I interviewed with 2 people, one of who was to become my direct supervisor and the other who had secured the funding for the research I was doing. It was a very pleasant, straight-forward interview, with a lot of room for Q&A and discussion.
Interview Questions: Q: How do you see your prior research experience being relevant to this role?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview for a postdoctoral scholar can vary by department but here I describe my experience in a science/ clinical Department. I arrived at UCLA and meet with the members of the lab. I had a private meeting with the lab's main principal investigator (PI) to discuss both my research and the research that the PI was conducting. The PI was especially interested in discussing my skill set and how that could be used to work on the new projects that I would be working on if I got hired. Also, I presented my dissertation research to the lab PI and other members of the lab.
Interview Questions: The interview questions were not gimmicky questions or case studies but instead related to my dissertation work.

title: GSR Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: UCLA application process, pass qualifying exam after course completion, interview with advisor, one academic quarter is generally a trial period to see how you fit in to the group and if you're demonstrating good performance. The goal of the entire process is to see if you are both capable and motivated to accomplish what the lab needs (as well as if you'll have the fortitude to see it through in the face of many failures).
Interview Questions: Many techincal questions for qualifying exam. PI asks how is your background valuable to this lab's work and what do you hope to achieve here. Why do you want to do this R&D?

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UCLA (New York, NY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Casual and friendly. Not too much pressure, but it's best to still be alert and focused. I submitted my resume two weeks before and got the interview. It was a 1:1 and it went well I had thought. I got an email 2 months later that after careful consideration they were going with another candidate who had more prior experience. I was not too disappointed because I had already made plans to go abroad that summer.
Interview Questions: How have you dealt with a teammate who was not pulling their weight in a group?

title: Senior Institutional Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UCLA (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I heard back from them about a phone interview about 3 weeks after I submitted my application. I had to complete 3 essay questions about problem solving situations before the interview. The position seems to be very IT focused, rather than research oriented.
Interview Questions: When you are communicating data to people who are not experts in the field, what is the most important thing?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview

title: Program Representative II Interview

They began with an overview of the unit's work and asked me questions mainly focused on my skills and my fit within the office - unlike other interviews I had gone on that were strictly behavioral.  I couldn't get a good read for the interviewers during the time I was there, but I guess it turned out well because they offered me the job a few days later (foregoing a second interview).
